summary: Poor water quality has played a key role in the decline of salmon populations in the Puget Sound region of Washington State. Salmon are culturally significant to area Tribes and are a cornerstone of the local economy. The Clean Water Act requires states to develop lists of bodies of water that don't meet quality standards. The Environmental Protection Agency approves these lists, which are used...
title: Puget Sound: Further Actions Could Improve Efforts to Address Impaired Water Quality That Threatens Salmon
